entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2:V4L2StatefulVD: fix EOS before CAPTURE queue started
entry.content:
This CL addresses the situation of receiving an End-of-Stream Decode()

before we have had time to configure and start the |CAPTURE_queue_|: in

this case the |OUTPUT_queue_| would be stopped and nothing will be

produced; this is indeed what happens for the CVPCMNL2_SVA_C.h264 test

vector, which only has SPS+PPS+I+I NALUs.



The solution is to simply defer processing the End-of-Stream. This

fixes the last failing H.264 test vector for trogdor.



Bug: b:279980150

entry.title: quick_answers: Add ReadWriteCardsManager
entry.content:
We are introducting a new card of EditorMenu, which shares the same

position of the QuickAnswers, but at different conditions.

To simplify the controller logic when to show which card, EditorMenu or

QuickAnswers, a common interface and manager are preferred.



The new class of ReadWriteCardsManager will own the

QuickAnswersController and EditorMenuController and return the

responding controller to the caller to show/update/close the card.



This cl adds the new interface and manager as a wrapper to the current

QuickAnswers code. No functional changes.



Bug: b/295582803

Causes consistent failures on

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac13-arm64-rel-tests



First failing run of the bot:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac13-arm64-rel-tests/4898/overview



The test CPUMeasurementMonitorTimingTest.ProcessLifetime is failing.

0 components_unittests 0x0000000103f4fa5c performance_manager::resource_attribution::(anonymous namespace)::RunOnPMSequence(base::OnceCallback) + 88



Original change's description:

> Fix first measurement time in CPUMeasurementMonitor::CPUMeasurement

>

> Now that CPUMeasurement records `last_measurement_time_` separately for

> each process, it's not possible for a "measurement interval" to start

> before the process was created.

>

> * Updates comments in MeasureAndDistributeCPUUsage(), which assumed

> measurements were always taken on a fixed schedule with a system-wide

> `last_measurement_time_`, to correctly describe processes measured on

> separate flexible schedules.

> * Initializes `last_measurement_time_` in the CPUMeasurement constructor

> when the first measurement is taken. The missed initialization was

> hidden because the process launch time was used as a fallback, which

> is not correct for processes that existed before CPUMeasurement

> objects were created by StartMonitoring().

> * Let time pass in unit tests between creating the process and

> StartMonitoring(). The bug was hidden by the mock clock in tests since

> the process launch time was the same time tick as the CPUMeasurement

> constructor, despite being created "before" StartMonitoring().

>

> Also adds more unit tests of error conditions.

>

> R=pmonette

>

entry.title: Fix GPU UPF suite names
entry.content:
Switches the GPU UPF query builder to convert names using the generated

name mapping instead of a manually curated list. This fixes the issue

with expected_color expectations being listed as unused and should make

it impossible for the mapping to get out of date in the future.

entry.title: [CSC] Persist contextual panel selection across side panel toggles on a tab.
entry.content:
If a contextual panel is opened on a tab and the panel is closed and

reopened, the same panel will reopen. This applies only to that tab;

other tabs will still default to showing the last opened global panel.

entry.title: Allow keyboard to be dismissed even if suggestions list doesn't scroll
entry.content:
The suggestions list doesn't need to scroll for suggestions to show

beneath the keyboard, even though it is most of then the case.



In certain situations, additional suggestions may be available below

the keyboard, but their number may not make the list scrollable.



This change relaxes the current restriction, permitting users to

dismiss the keyboard even if suggestions list doesn't show.



Change-Id: I478a17da65e01124b35d2e4a29f74538b00bc138

entry.title: [iOS] Refactor deprecated MDCFlatButton in Sad Tab Page
entry.content:
This button was deprecated back in iOS 12 and we have been silencing

the deprecation warning. To keep our codebase clean, we refactor this

to be a normal UIButton using UIButtonConfiguration. This also means

that we lose the ink effect but this is okay since it's a negligible

UI change in exchange for future stability.

entry.title: Allow legacy tech report use top level url
entry.content:
Using top-level url may be easy for admin to understand and setup policy

for legacy tech report. But it will reduce the flexibility of the

feature.



Hence the fix will be behind a flag with default off for now.



Also add log for url matching result.

entry.title: Revert "Re-enable wpt fcp-document-opacity-text.html"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4d2f8c65de91e554c6e7ced6f4a3f61c44b877a3.



Reason for revert:

Test consistently fails on

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac11-arm64-rel-tests



Example failing bot run:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac11-arm64-rel-tests/24523/overview



actual_text:

This is a testharness.js-based test.

PASS Test that FCP after opacity change is not a larger value than LCP

Harness: the test ran to completion.



expected_text:

This is a testharness.js-based test.

FAIL Test that FCP after opacity change is not a larger value than LCP assert_less_than_equal: LCP is not smaller than FCP expected a number less than or equal to 35.399 but got 35.39999999990687

Harness: the test ran to completion.





(By the way, I'm surprised the expected_text is a failure. Maybe the links in the build bot are wrong and mixed up expected versus actual? Or maybe the expected text actual expects that particular message? In any case, giving back to the person who most recently touched the code to investigate and fix further. My only duty as gardener is to keep the tree clean, which means reverting this change.)



Original change's description:

> Re-enable wpt fcp-document-opacity-text.html

>

> This CL is to re-enable wpt

> external/wpt/paint-timing/fcp-only/fcp-document-opacity-text.html

>

> The previous failure is a timestamp precision issue. See details in the

> bug. It should have been fixed by a previous CL

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4425391

>

> Bug: 1311128

> Change-Id: Iacda1bd70fe67df985e11a28603f7d1f56e94184

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4852037

> Commit-Queue: Hao Liu

> Reviewed-by: Ian Clelland

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1194083}

entry.title: chrome views: Remove linux-specific codes from Lacros
entry.content:
Root user check is specific to Linux.



Quote from the mail thread

> Those are there specifically for Linux, since on Linux you could imagine a user running as root and wanting to start Chrome.



For Lacros, given that we know we'll always be launching Lacros either from Ash or from session_manager (in either case, something that we control) I don't think we need those checks.



(https://groups.google.com/a/google.com/g/lacros-fundamentals/c/3xubOsE5ghE/m/DIeixMU9AAAJ)

entry.title: [bookmarks] Refactor URL-index-building code
entry.content:
No behavioral changes, just a bunch of code improvements:

1. Variables are renamed to disambiguate what "index" means in

preparation for an additional index being introduced.

2. Index-building code is moved from ModelLoader to BookmarkLoadDetails,

which seems a better home and avoids workarounds in tests

(TestBookmarkClient).

3. Comments are modernized to use ` instead of |, following latest

style guidance.

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Showing a blank sheet resets the timestamp
entry.content:
An empty sheet can be shown if it's interrupted during showing.

It looks like a gray line with only a big scrim behind it.

In rare cases when a user sees this, the timestamp should not be

recorded and the sheet should be reshown as soon as the next triggering

action occurs.



We also want to check the hypothesis that the sheet can be

interrupted only on startup. That's why a new histogram is added.



Bug: 1479012

entry.title: iwa: Make parser and data source closable
entry.content:
Given that we have to delete the .swbn files (e.g. for IWA

uninstallation or install failure), we should know when the file is

closed. For this purpose the method Close() is added. After calling

entry.title: [mullet m2] Adds ServerFieldTypeSet helper methods to `autofill_type`.
entry.content:
We are introducing methods that map a `FieldTypeGroup` to its

respective (including a ServerFieldTypeSet that represents all fields).



We will use this to achieve group filling, i.e filling a specific group

of target fields.



1. This will be used by the manager to have a target fields to fill.

2. To introduce this I made ToSafeServerFieldType and a const expr.

3. This is required to easily remove `filling_granularity` from

`TriggeringDetails`.

4. The methods added are not used and for now this is a no-op change.

entry.title: Add C++ upstart wrapper.
entry.content:
ChromeOS C++ tests have a need to do job control operations. This adds

an "upstart" wrapper mostly equivalent to the similar library in Tast

for doing basic job controls.



Note that since the tests don't run as root, mutation operations will

not currently work. This problem is being addressed in parallel and will

be ported to this library when available.

entry.title: Add support for clip-path <geometry-box> with border-radius
entry.content:
Clip-path values should honor border-radius, see:

https://drafts.csswg.org/css-shapes-1/#shapes-from-box-values. To

implement this, ClipPathClipper::LocalReferenceBox has been refactored

so that a rounded variant can be added (RoundedReferenceBox).

entry.title: Properly escape regular expressions in raw_ptr_unittest.nc
entry.content:
The assert statement that we seek to test contains a bitwise-or

operator `|` which is being interpreted in the compiled regex

as if it were an either-or along the lines of `(a|b)`. As a result,

only the characters appearing after the `|` need match for success.

Convert this to `\|` so the whole string must match.



Doing so produces a number of failures, as the constants have

had their values adjusted since the tests were written.



-- fix same issue in raw_ref_unittest.nc

entry.title: Fix first measurement time in CPUMeasurementMonitor::CPUMeasurement
entry.content:
Now that CPUMeasurement records `last_measurement_time_` separately for

each process, it's not possible for a "measurement interval" to start

before the process was created.



* Updates comments in MeasureAndDistributeCPUUsage(), which assumed

measurements were always taken on a fixed schedule with a system-wide

`last_measurement_time_`, to correctly describe processes measured on

separate flexible schedules.

* Initializes `last_measurement_time_` in the CPUMeasurement constructor

when the first measurement is taken. The missed initialization was

hidden because the process launch time was used as a fallback, which

is not correct for processes that existed before CPUMeasurement

objects were created by StartMonitoring().

* Let time pass in unit tests between creating the process and

StartMonitoring(). The bug was hidden by the mock clock in tests since

the process launch time was the same time tick as the CPUMeasurement

constructor, despite being created "before" StartMonitoring().



Also adds more unit tests of error conditions.



R=pmonette



Bug: 1471683

Change-Id: Ieb63a23743e3f7596621bb4958c7723b07600802

entry.title: IppUsb: Refactor AutomaticUsbPrinterConfigurer
entry.content:
Refactor the implementation of automatic setup of USB printers. The

logic responsible for USB printers autoconfiguration was moved from

CupsPrintersManager to AutomaticUsbPrinterConfigurer. The class

AutomaticUsbPrinterConfigurer was rewritten.



Now, CupsPrintersManager provides to AutomaticUsbPrinterConfigurer a

list of all currently connected USB printers by calling a method

UpdateListOfConnectedPrinters(). This method calculates the difference

between the given list of printers and the list passed in the previous

call. Printers that disappeared from the list are uninstalled. For

each new printer on the list, an installation procedure is started.

When the procedure for a given printer finishes, the printer is

assigned to the list of configured printers (when the setup succeeded)

or to the list of unconfigured printers (when the automatic setup

failed). CupsPrintersManager uses these two list to update the lists

of Automatic and Discovered printers.



BUG=b:184293121

TEST=unit_tests and tested manually on atlas



Change-Id: I91a84bcde2f165aa8d2dc0b35e7a45da1304d164

entry.title: Reland "Only create AXObjects while processing deferred events"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 7bcb222bea155538409983c7cba304a9454888e0



Reason for revert: This CL is causing AXImageAnnotatorTest.OnImageAdded to fail only on Fuchsia builders. See crbug.com/1480210 and the

failures in patchset 7. The test fails on Fuchsia because post-lifecycle

serialization has been temporary disabled on Fuchsia, affecting

timing of flushes in Blink. However the test failure does not

represent a change in behavior, as the only difference in the test

expectations is whether the the same image is added to the annotator

service once vs. twice. The annotator does its own deduping. The issue

blocking post-lifecycle serialization in Fuchsia is being actively

worked on in bug fuchsia:132924.



Fix that allows reland: disable the test until post-lifecycle

serialization is turned on in Fuchsia.



Original change's description:

> Only create AXObjects while processing deferred events

>

> By restricting this, the number of potential patterns is reduced,

> making Blink a11y more predictable.

>

> As a follow-up, we could consider making GetOrCreate() a private

> method, and only allow Get() from outside of AXObjectCache.

>

> Fixed: 1477873, 1478594

> Change-Id: Ia8015f896e74c9bdad60cbf74e87257c1db3501c

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4833300

> Reviewed-by: Chris Harrelson

> Commit-Queue: Aaron Leventhal

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1193806}



Fixed: 1480210, 1477873, 1478594

Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:fuchsia-x64-rel,fuchsia-arm64-rel

Change-Id: I8e942ee6c68eac3dce78450ac67ab4377c9308f9

Cq-Do-Not-Cancel-Tryjobs: true

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4852102

entry.content:
Before this patch, the bottom sheet version of the virtual card number

(VCN) enrollment dialog did not log metrics when users tapped any of the

links in the dialog, unlike the infobar version of this dialog.



This patch moves the "dialog source" accessor public and uses it to log

the "link clicked" metric in the native C++ bridge for the VCN

enrollment bottom sheet.



After this patch, tapping on a link in the VCN enroll bottom sheet will

log the metric for that tap. The bottom sheet version of the UI is

behind a flag:

entry.content:

supposed to annotate last key with passed `last_key_version` (rest

entry.title: GCC: Put attributes before function name in partition_root.h
entry.content:
By GCC attributes are not allowed to be placed after function name

in a function definition. This breaks compilation in GCC.



The error example:

base/allocator/partition_allocator/partition_alloc_forward.h:80:27:

error: attributes are not allowed on a function-definition

base/allocator/partition_allocator/partition_root.h:467:7:

note: in expansion of macro 'PA_MALLOC_ALIGNED'

entry.title: Prerendering refactoring in preparation for session history prerendering
entry.content:
This CL contains several modifications that will be needed for the

implementation of session history prerendering but can be made

independently. Specifically:

- Use default member initializers in PrerenderAttributes to make adding

another constructor easier (and for self-documentation).

- Have the existing metrics tests for session history prerendering pass

a ukm source id explicitly, as the logic for retrieving this will

change in the case of a prerendering activation.

- Have the mouse back button test explicitly order the mouse up event

after the eligibility decision. If the navigation happens before the

decision on whether to prerender is made, then there's no need for the

prerender.

- Provide a WebContentsDelegate to cloned WebContents in several tests.

Prerendering code fails closed without a delegate indicating prerender

support.



Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:linux-bfcache-rel

entry.title: Add Sub-Label to Compact FeatureTiles
entry.content:
Adds sub-label support to compact FeatureTiles. A sub-label can now be

added to a compact tile by setting the sub-label text and updating

the sub-label visibility. By default, the sub-label on compact tiles

will be hidden and need to be manually set to visible after setting the

sub-label text.



If a compact FeatureTile has a sub-label, it only allows one row each

for the primary label and sub-label. By default, compact FeatureTiles

will allow two rows for the primary label as originally designed. If a

user updates the sub-label to be visible on a compact tile, the primary

label and sub-label will be allowed one row of text each.

entry.content:
After talking with the most likely users of enable_profiling, I learned

that this is basically dead code - our profiling tools work "out of the

box" without setting enable_profiling. This is now only needed if

someone were to want to do ARM32 profiling, which is quite uncommon and

may not work for other reasons anyways.

entry.title: [iOS] Replace failing (D)CHECKs in coordinators with DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECK
entry.content:
This CL is part of the fix [1] that was proposed to deal with the

increasing number of crashes related to child coordinators. This CL

converts CHECKs and DCHECKs that have been failing in relation to the

issue with DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECK. The goal is to get reports from those on

Stable without crashing the app. We'll be able to get a better signal on

how often these fail because the request to restart the child

coordinator happens before the previous instance had enough time to be

cleaned up vs other causes.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1s3d2aQNYIAuZJcEW2PWki-xzD44BwckFP8HSm3r5hoE/edit#heading=h.2px6trsn0jl1

entry.title: [iOS] Enable password count overrides via Experimental settings.
entry.content:
This change enables manual overriding of weak, reused, and compromised

password counts for the Safety Check (Magic Stack) module.



For each type of password issue (weak, reused, compromised), the only

interesting overrides are for a single password of that type (i.e. 1),

or multiple passwords of that type (i.e. 1+).

entry.title: Fix EventReportWindows Mojo validation
entry.content:
- Validate that end_times.size is <= kMaxEventLevelReportWindows

- Validate that vector passed to CreateWindows is strictly increasing,

not just sorted

- Add test coverage



Without these changes, a compromised renderer could send invalid values

that ultimately end up being used or causing CHECK failures on the

browser side.

state observer outlasts the browser, due to a dangling raw_ptr.



The raw_ptr is used during several stages of setup of the observer, but

is irrelevant after that, so may be left dangling without causing

problems.

entry.title: [iOS] Do not sign out after history sync declined from settings/NTP
entry.content:
For all entry points except the Recent Tabs, when the user goes through

a sign-in + history sync flow, the user should not be signed out if

history sync is declined. Especially for the settings and NTP entry

points.



This CL fixes the issue by introducing a new init parameter for

HistorySyncPopupCoordinator to handle the sign-out, and adds a

corresponding EGTest for the settings.

entry.title: iwa: Wait for ongoing updates to complete before serving requests
entry.content:
If an update is in the process of being applied, pause all requests to

the IWA until the update is applied. There are two cases where this is

relevant:

- Normally, we wait for all windows of an IWA to close, and only then

kick-off the update apply process. However, if the user were to

re-open an IWA window during the update apply process, we need to

delay loading of the window contents until after the update has

finished applying.

- On startup, if updates from the previous browser session are still

pending (possibly because the user never closed the windows of the

IWA), then we queue the pending updates to be applied. However, if

either the user or the browser opens an IWA window while we apply

updates, we need to wait for that to finish, similar to the case

above.



currently disabled due to crbug.com/1479463.



Low-Coverage-Reason: There is a test for Ash, but the Lacros test is

entry.title: [Mullet m2] Sub-popup keyboard control support.
entry.content:
This CL adds support for the keyboard control of sub-popups. The most

significant UI change is the LEFT (or RIGHT in rtl) and ESC keys

entry.content:

where the LEFT/RIGHT keys indirectly manage popup closing. Having their

handlers in the popup view makes the whole keyboard control flow more

explicit.

entry.title: [Mullet m2] Autofill popup views, close by no selection in children.
entry.content:
According the UX requirements all sub-popups should be closed (with

some delay) when the user moves mouse out of any (sub-)popup, this

CL supports this logic. It also improves the child-parent mouse move events retranslation to fix the case when the mouse moves too fast,

producing not enough move events and leaving the sub-popup open.

entry.title: Add netlog calls to UDPClientSocket
entry.content:
* Make UDPClientSocket an actual netlog source

* Track its lifetime through SOCKET_ALIVE

* Track calls to Open/Connect/BindToNetwork



This was useful to figure out why connection migration was failing in

a yet-to-merge integration tests. The probing socket BindToNetwork

call was failing due to a missing permission.



# Connection migration failing example

## Before

Source type:QUIC_SESSION, Description: test.example.com, Entry:

[...]

t= 36 [st=31] QUIC_SESSION_NETWORK_MADE_DEFAULT

--> new_default_network = 432902426637

t= 36 [st=31] QUIC_CONNECTION_MIGRATION_ON_NETWORK_MADE_DEFAULT

--> new_default_network = 432902426637

t= 37 [st=32] QUIC_CONNECTION_MIGRATION_ON_MIGRATE_BACK

--> retry_count = 0

t= 37 [st=32] QUIC_CONNECTION_MIGRATION_FAILURE

--> connection_id = "5eaf24f6fb345513"

--> reason = "Socket configuration failed"

Source type:UDP_SOCKET, Description: None, Entry:

t=37 [st=0] SOCKET_ALIVE [dt=0]

--> source_dependency = 13 (QUIC_SESSION)



## After

Source type:QUIC_SESSION, Description: test.example.com, Entry:

[...]

t= 36 [st=31] QUIC_SESSION_NETWORK_MADE_DEFAULT

--> new_default_network = 432902426637

t= 36 [st=31] QUIC_CONNECTION_MIGRATION_ON_NETWORK_MADE_DEFAULT

--> new_default_network = 432902426637

t= 37 [st=32] QUIC_CONNECTION_MIGRATION_ON_MIGRATE_BACK

--> retry_count = 0

t= 37 [st=32] QUIC_CONNECTION_MIGRATION_FAILURE

--> connection_id = "5eaf24f6fb345513"

--> reason = "Socket configuration failed"

Source type:UDP_CLIENT_SOCKET, Description: None, Entry:

t=42 [st=0] +SOCKET_ALIVE [dt=2]

--> source_dependency = 16 (QUIC_SESSION)

t=42 [st=0] SOCKET_OPEN

t=43 [st=1] SOCKET_BIND_TO_NETWORK

--> net_error = -10 (ERR_ACCESS_DENIED)

--> network = -889270259

t=44 [st=2] -SOCKET_ALIVE

Source type:UDP_SOCKET, Description: None, Entry:

t=42 [st=0] SOCKET_ALIVE [dt=2]

--> source_dependency = 22 (UDP_CLIENT_SOCKET)



Bug: b:290583020

Change-Id: Ia3e5e52c966dafea5bd0f4d27c4e936a1abeb361

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4839443

entry.title: Use the new STACK_ALLOCATED tool on ScopedNSAutoreleasePool
entry.content:
ScopedNSAutoreleasePool needs to be used strictly scoped. Use the

STACK_ALLOCATED tool to try to enforce this, and annotate the current

violations.



This CL also switches from using raw pointers to using

absl::optional. While that fixes some leaks, the resulting lifetimes

were wrong, so those needed to be adjusted.

entry.title: Set SkSerialProcs for explicit image encoding
entry.content:
Skia plans to stop the default behavior of encoding SkImages in

SkPictures using a PNG encoder. To preserve that behavior,

clients need to explicitly set an SkSerialProc to do so.



I assume that picture_debug_util.cc and gpu_benchmarking_extension.cc

both have SkPictures which could contain SkImages. I can tell by

inspection serial_utils_unittest.cc does not, but figured we could

make the use of the default behavior explicit.

entry.title: Only consider reference box zoom when applying clip-path
entry.content:
Clip-paths use a reference box which may or may not include zoom (to

handle html and svg contexts). The clip-path implementation is

recursive, to support clip-paths on clip-paths, and was incorrectly

using the current clip-path object for adjusting the reference box's

zoom. This patch separately tracks both the current clip path owner

object and the reference box object, and only uses the latter for zoom.

This fixes a hit testing regression from https://crrev.com/1185100, as

well as a pre-existing rendering bug (tests added for each).

entry.title: [Android Autofill] Replace CHECK by dump without crashing.
entry.content:
As part of moving to observing server predictions, a silent return

if the AutofillProviderAndroid's manager_ member was null (but

it's form_ matched that for which predictions are received)

was replaced by a CHECK.



This appears to have triggered a crash in the wild. This CL replaces

the check by a return, but includes a crash dump with some debug

information to trace how the program can reach this state.

entry.title: Stop saving hashes in the SelectorFilter.
entry.content:
It's cheaper to just compute them anew than to allocate memory for them.

Note that this also means that the parent stack now exclusively exists

for the purpose of checking consistency. Performance is slightly

positive, but this is mostly just a simplification wrt. the recent

crash bug.

Java PDM and request for it.

startup which has the prefetched images.

We had initially thought about using the existing

`IsolatedWebAppNavigationThrottle` for this purpose. However, given that

we'll have to make the creation of the `IsolatedWebAppURLLoader`

asynchronous to support waiting for an ongoing update to be applied

anyways, it feels simplest to just also wait for `WebAppProvider`

readiness inside the `IsolatedWebAppURLLoaderFactory`.

entry.title: Fix url_request_quic_perftest.cc
entry.content:
This performance test doesn't appear to run anywhere automatically and

so has been broken for at least two years.



Fix the segfault from accessing an unitialised MockCertVerifier.



Also fix the QUIC certificate error.



Remove the memory dump analysis. The facility it used was removed in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3153098. The

test is now almost a pure performance test (it still verifies that QUIC

is actually used).



Re-enable the test on Fuchsia as the bit that was timing out is no

longer there.



Make some things constexpr.



TESTED=net_perftests --gtest_filter=URLRequestQuicPerfTest.TestGetRequest
